title: How to Root a Samsung Galaxy Tab 4

steps.title: Create a backup of your entire data on the Galaxy Tab 4, so that you are able to restore everything after the rooting procedure meets its end.
steps.content: Create a backup of your entire data on the Galaxy Tab 4, so that you are able to restore everything after the rooting procedure meets its end.

steps.title: Navigate through the settings mode.
steps.content: Navigate through the settings mode. Enable the USB debugging mode from the Developer option available in the menu.

steps.title: Make sure your computer comprises of all the drivers for the tablet to ensure smooth rooting process.
steps.content: Make sure your computer comprises of all the drivers for the tablet to ensure smooth rooting process. Some computers come with a security option that might obstruct the rooting process. Ensure that all the security options are turned off before you connect your Tab 4 with the computer. As far as possible, use the original Samsung USB cable to undertake rooting process, so that no complications occur while rooting your Galaxy Tab 4

steps.title: Ensure that the battery of your Tab 4 is completely charged, since a battery discharge during the rooting process could cause your Tab 4 to get damaged permanently.
steps.content: Ensure that the battery of your Tab 4 is completely charged, since a battery discharge during the rooting process could cause your Tab 4 to get damaged permanently.

steps.title: Download all of the rooting files for the Tab 4 in addition to the ODIN file that initiates the rooting process.
steps.content: Download all of the rooting files for the Tab 4 in addition to the ODIN file that initiates the rooting process.

steps.title: Extract the rooting files in any folder on your desktop.
steps.content: Extract the rooting files in any folder on your desktop.

steps.title: Put your Galaxy Tab 4 on "Download Mode" by holding the volume down and home key buttons simultaneously.
steps.content: Put your Galaxy Tab 4 on "Download Mode" by holding the volume down and home key buttons simultaneously. While holding these keys, power your device on.

steps.title: Connect your device to a computer via USB cable.
steps.content: Connect your device to a computer via USB cable. Subsequent to this, the ID:COM section will display a blue or yellow light that indicated the driver installation process has begun successfully.

steps.title: After extracting the firmware package and pressing "Start"; Click on the PDA button from ODIN to select the ‘Tar’ file you received.
steps.content: After extracting the firmware package and pressing "Start"; Click on the PDA button from ODIN to select the ‘Tar’ file you received. Your Galaxy Tab 4 should now go into the update mode. The entire update process may take around 4 to 5 minutes to complete, after which the entire rooting process is finalized.

steps.title: Wait for the reboot.
steps.content: Wait for the reboot. After the completion of the update process, your Galaxy Tab 4 reboots automatically meaning it has rooted completely. To verify whether your Galaxy Tab 4 has rooted, use the root checker application, available for download across various portals on the internet.
